results.name: Smallest odd prime factor of 3^n + 1, for n > 1.
comment: Levi Ben Gerson (1288-1344) proved that 3^n + 1 = 2^m has no solution in integers if n > 1, by showing that 3^n + l has an odd prime factor. His proof uses remainders after division of powers of 3 by 8 and powers of 2 by 8; see the Lenstra and Peterson links. For an elegant short proof, see the Franklin link.
reference: L. E. Dickson, History of the Theory of Numbers, Vol. II, Chelsea, NY 1992; see p. 731.
